page.title: 19TIME-SERVICES IN WALSALL
page.content: Time governs many of the activities of the town - Milk is delivered at breakfast time, as are the first letters. There is one dairy which delivers much later than this. The second post is at lunch-time. Most newsagents employ newsboys who deliver national newspapers at breakfast-time and local papers, the "Express and Star" (Walsall edition) and the "Evening Mail", at tea-time. The "Walsall Observer" is delivered weekly as are the 'free' papers, the "Trader" and the "Advertiser." Street lights come on at dusk and go off at dawn. Refuse is collected weekly. West Midlands Passenger Transport Executive has a depot within the area which has regular services to all parts of the town and beyond.
